member.summary: Redirect the standard output and standard error to named pipes with the specified names. On Windows, these are actually named pipes; on Linux and macOS, these are Unix sockets (matching the behaviour of System.IO.Pipes). Note that this has side-effects.

member.name: M:MuPDFCore.MuPDFDocument.#ctor(MuPDFCore.MuPDFContext,System.Byte[],MuPDFCore.InputFileTypes)
member.summary: Create a new from an array of bytes.
member.param: The context that will own this document.

An array containing the data bytes that make up the document. This must not be altered until after the has been disposed! The address of the array will be pinned, which may cause degradation in the Garbage Collector's performance, and is thus only advised for short-lived documents. To avoid this issue, marshal the bytes to unmanaged memory and use one of the constructors.
The type of the document to read.

The address of the 's buffer will be pinned, which may cause degradation in the Garbage Collector's performance, and is thus only advised for short-lived documents. To avoid this issue, marshal the bytes to unmanaged memory and use one of the constructors.
The type of the document to read.

member.returns: If the document was successfully unlocked (or if it was never locked to begin with), if the password was incorrect and the document is still locked.
member.remarks: This method can be used both to unlock an encrypted document and to check whether the supplied owner password is correct.

member.summary: Render the specified region to an image of the specified size, split in a number of tiles equal to the number of threads used by this , without marshaling. This method will not return until all the rendering threads have finished. Since creating an array of is not allowed, this method returns a delegate that accepts an integer parameter (representing the index of the span in the "array") and returns the corresponding to that index.
member.param: The total size of the image that should be rendered.
The region in page units that should be rendered.
A collection of s that can be used to free the memory where the rendered tiles are stored. You should keep track of these and dispose them when you have finished working with the images.
The format of the pixel data.
member.returns: A delegate that accepts an integer parameter (representing the index of the span in the "array") and returns the corresponding to that index.

member.name: M:MuPDFCore.TesseractLanguage.#ctor(MuPDFCore.TesseractLanguage.Fast,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new object using a fast integer version of a trained model for the specified language. The language file is downloaded from the tesseract-ocr/tessdata_fast GitHub repository. If it has already been downloaded and cached before, the downloaded file is re-used.
member.param: The language to use for the OCR process.

If this is , if a cached trained model file is available for the specified language, it will be used even if it is a "best (most accurate)" model. Otherwise, only cached fast integer trained models will be used.

If this is , if a cached trained model file is available for the specified language, it will be used even if it is a "fast" model. Otherwise, only cached best (most accurate) trained models will be used.
